The best sushi and bar in the City!  I love going with friends and my husband any day of the week!

The atmosphere, waiter  and presentation were fantastic. The miso soup was so bland that it was more like dish water with mushrooms.  Had a lobster roll, toro and soft shell crab roll.  All lack any flavor other than the bitter taste of raw asparagus.  Not what it used to be and definitely not worth the $60.00 per person price tag. Too bad as I remember it being really good two years ago.

I am new to Charlotte, and came into Baku with only these reviews on yelp to guide me.  I am here to tell you that this is one of the best sushi places I have ever been to.  From the moment I walked in and was greeted, to when I sat at the bar and was immedately served by Joey the bartender, I was treated like a VIP.  The Yellowfin Tuna roll was made custom with an added ingredients with no issues.  The Sazerac was made with expertise.  But the pork belly skewers stole the show.  They were legit, and were highly recommended by Joey.  I will definately be back with a date.

There is not much I enjoyed about this restaurant. I will start with what I did like. The patio, it had a lot of shade, great atmosphere and comfortable seating. With that being said we had to wait a long time before we were greeted by our server. I am going to give them the benefit of the doubt and say they were not informed that we had been seated out there, even still quite a few other servers walked by a few times and they didn't even notice or offer to get someone for us. The sushi we ordered was not good at all. Especially for how expensive it was. If you like traditional sushi this is not the restaurant for you.  The saki was good but again, over priced.

I love the vibe of this place.  Great quality good, but fairly small portions. They have valet parking if needed.   My favorite dishes are the scallop skewers, calamari app, and the sushi rolls. The pork belly app is also very delicious if seafood is not your style. Not the best to come here starving or your bill will be quite large.   Tip: if you are looking for a quieter dining experience I recommend requesting to seat downstairs, especially on the weekends. If you enjoy a more lively experience sit upstairs where the bar is at. Also a tv or two up there. On the weekends the music is turned up and it is very energetic, but may be too loud for some. They also have a small patio area out front.

Went with a friend who likes sushi to this restaurant. Made a reservation on OpenTable and when we arrived the restaurant was virtually empty and they asked if we wanted to be seated upstairs for some reason. We ask to be seated downstairs  and throughout the meal the restaurant was still virtually empty .  I ordered the salmon and the brussel sprouts. The salmon entree arrived and half of it was raw. The brussel sprouts were the leafs of the sprouts and very few solid pieces of Brussel sprouts. This was a side dish for $9  My friend enjoyed her sushi. Menus left on the table for our entire meal and had to ask twice to have water glasses refilled.  The wine was excellent.

This place is absolutely awesome. I'm generally a tough critic but this place has blown me away. The service has been great and the food has been even better. I would recommend this Asian fusion to anyone!!! This place focuses on experience, which is sooooo appreciated.   Anthony is the best waiter in Charlotte!

This is my favorite Japanese restaurant! I had the dragon roll while my husband had their famous baby rack ribs and once again Baku amazed us! We were treated so nicely and the owner took the time to explain the menu and enhance our experience. We're bringing our friends next weekend for our double date and we're sure they'll be impressed. Can't wait to eat there again.

This is hands down the best restaurant I've been to in Charlotte. In fact, it might be the best restaurant I've ever been to. It has great aesthetics, great music, phenomenal drinks, and incredible food. The service is on point and all servers are very knowledgable about the menu. I've never been disappointed by this place. Do yourself a favor and take your next date to Baku. (Just don't forget your wallet!)

Baku is unique, the decor, the presentation, service, and who cares about all that if the food isn't dazzling, it's very expensive, but it's worth the price, my hat is off for the Chefs and their crew.  If your wallet has some weight to shed pay a visit, you won't regret.
Excellent!  Every dish is like a work of Art. Wonderful atmosphere, excellent food and service!

Worst place in town.  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.  My family and I made reservations for my birthday.  It was our first time trying out the place.  Our reservation was for 7:45 pm.  We arrived on time and was told by the host our table would be ready shortly.  We moved to the side and waited.  We waited five minutes... ten minutes... fifteen minutes... twenty minutes... twenty-five minutes... thirty minutes.  Still did not get our so-called reserved seat.    Meanwhile, other guests who walked in the door with no reservations got sat almost immediately.  What's the point of making a reservation at this establishment?  They will take reservations but they will not honor them.  We complained to the manager, who didn't apologize or made any attempts at trying to reconcile the situation.  The blonde female host is completely unprofessional and rude.  They all need a course in How-To-Be-A-Civil-Person 101.  We left. We don't plan on going there ever again.  F*** you, Baku.  P.S.  We also witnessed one of the line cooks literally blowing on the food he was cooking, while it was on the grill - spit and everything.  It must be the secret ingredient.

This is hands down the best restaurant in Charlotte. Yes it's expensive. Yes the portion sizes are small and you need to order a good amount of food to feel full but that's what a fine dining restaurant is like (which Charlotte is not too familiar with). The food is amazing especially their wagyu beef and Nigiri. However, their dessert chocolate cake tasted like the instant Betty Crocker stuff. I will still let that slide as the appetizers and main course and the service were exceptional. Also loved the contemporary feel. If this restaurant closes there really will be no options in this city next time I want a fancy night out.

Amazing food, excellent service and a very cool atmosphere.  I will say that it is VERY pricey.  For a full meal with wine/drinks, starters, etc I would say this is just as expensive as The Palm, Capital Grill, etc...  It's definitely with trying and if on a budget just  look for more reasonably priced small pates and rolls.

I went to Baku to celebrate my son's birthday.  It was fantastic, a true foodie restaurant.  I read the reviews and had a rough idea of what I wanted to order but it was restaurant week and decided to order off that menu.  I saw another reviewer mention John W. we got him too and he expertly helped select the courses.  Calamari was perfect, Hamachi role very good.  We added the pork belly because of the rave reviews; it was great too.   Great atmosphere, great food, expensive but you'll be glad you treated yourself and guests.  I'll be back for sure and looking for John W. again.

Came here for my dad's birthday dinner and was very interested in trying Baku. I have read several reviews and seen plenty of pictures of this restaurant especially when it first opened but it seemed like the hype died down recently.  I made reservations last minute in fear it might be busy on a Friday evening but I had no trouble making reservations on the way to the restaurant. When we arrived I realized I probably did not even need the reservations, there was not a wait and not many people in the restaurant We were immediately taken upstairs to the a dining area. I did like the decor and lounge feel of the restaurant.  Our waiter was very prompt and helpful. Unfortunately he told us that they are in the process of changing the menu so a lot of the menu items are no longer available, ie a lot of the items I saw on Yelp. Because the menu is tapas style we just started ordering everything that sounded good to us.  Pork wontons: these were ok, they were good size and plenty to share among the 3 of us. Brussels sprouts: my favorite item, they were crispy but also a little sweet with a sweet soy sauce drizzled. Pork Belly: good size pork belly but not cooked crispy enough for me, a little too fatty. Dragon Roll: I enjoyed the dragon roll, because my mom is allergic to avocado we had to sub for extra eel which caused them to up-charge us but we all still enjoyed the roll Sea Bass: My dad ordered the sea bass and I did not try it but he said it was ok but which it was cook a little crispier.  Beignets: beignets were not the normal beignets but there were a nice dessert to share after dinner. The ice cream that is on top tasted more of a whipped frosting or something more than ice cream.   Overall Baku is a nice restaurant and the atmosphere makes it a nice place for a low key dinner. I would be interested in seeing the new menu.

We came here for Charlotte restaurant week last night. We ordered the edamame and Brussels sprouts, both were very good. Next course we got the maki and the calamari. The sushi was awesome but they only give you 4 tiny pieces!  And finally our main courses were served, salmon and steak for my husband. We just hope that's their restaurant week size portion because we would NEVER pay their full price menu price for those cuts of meat!! Would like to go back and try sushi next time!
Don't bother! Pretentious, over rated, and boring. Just keep driving or go back home and make Ramen Noodles.

Went again last night.  Another awesome night.  This time we had the pork dumplings, Alaskan king crab, tenderloin with asparagus skewers, salmon nigiri and calamari.  Washed it down with the unfiltered Belvedere martini with a few extra olives... this place is my favorite place in Charlotte.  Everything is excellent.  Food, décor, service... just go here and eat something already.

I came here to celebrate my mother's birthday, and well we had to do it pretty big. There's some things you just have to get here, and it should be required. I think if you're going to spend money on sushi and normal items that you can get anywhere else...you can, but just know there are a lot of other things on the menu that you're missing out. Let's just say I didn't do much ordering, as my brother mostly had that on lock since he knew what was good and wasn't.  What did we eat... Good question. Let's just say it was an assortment of food and the quality were all great. I'll go through each photo, but to be honest, the otoro is what you should look at getting (the picture that's on the ice). I think that dish is amazing especially just the experience of it. There are all these other options as well, but to me that one stood out.   The restaurant is a little dark, but it's going for the lounge/romantic setting which I understand. We sat upstairs next to the bar and it was pretty comfortable. If you're looking for a good solid sushi/japanese restaurant and it's for a special occasion, I would definitely suggest that Baku would be on that list.

John W, our server, was absolutely phenomenal. Since the menu was slightly intimidating, John took his time to walk us through the menu, hinting at what we may or may not enjoy according to our unique palates.   We started the night with a decadent cucumber mint martini which was refreshing after just milling about South Park Mall. The Martini was followed up by the crispy calamari. This calamari was paired with a chipotle mayo sauce and a grilled lemon. The kick of lemons acidic juices added an extra layer of flavor atop the delicately fried, perfectly seasoned, squid pieces. I cannot rave enough about the calamari served here. I find that calamari, if not quality squid, is chewy and rubbery. However, at Baku this was not the case-- the calamari was buttery and smooth, it melted in my mouth.    Next up: the seasonal tempura vegetables. Unlike most tempura, the chefs only fried a thin crust around the various veggies, which complemented the vegetables flavors instead of overpowering them. This dish, akin to the calamari was served with a grilled lemon but instead of a mayo based sauce, it was a miso-soy-herb medley. Absolutely stunning.   We continued onto one of the salads, the roasted eggplant and tomato to be exact. This dish was another piece of art. The dish was a mountain of Japanese eggplant cut into small ovals and roasted to perfection. The seedy consistency of the eggplant was paired with crisp heirloom tomatoes that waited at the bottom of the eggplant mountain, acting as sort of a foundation for the plate. I decided to cross-contaminate here and dipped the eggplants into the miso-herb sauce that came with the vegetable tempura.   Lastly was our sushi-- and boy was it worth the wait. We had an order of Gokujo Tuna and Forbidden. Both were presented beautifully. Forbidden was wrapped with black rice, a nice change of pace from the normal sticky sushi rice. The black rice added an extra crunch to the roll. The gokujo tuna roll had a wonderful underlying heat that amped the flavors up a bit. This heat is reminiscent of a wasabi type heat-- one that comes through your nose and mouth then tapers off slowly. Paired with this heat was the yuzu sauce, a citrusy sauce that truly pulls the plate together.   Overall, Baku was phenomenal. I look forward to coming back.

One of the worst restaurant experiences we've had in Charlotte. We were never asked if we wanted refills on our drinks, and the entrees came out almost 15 minutes apart. Mine was getting cold so I had to eat it, and my wife's didn't arrive until I was almost done. Will not be coming back here. Very disappointing.

Baku has great decor and ambiance. Upstairs has a bar and a casual atmosphere. Downstairs is a little more formal. We sat upstairs.   Let's first talk about the service. The wait staff is well trained. They really explain the dishes well and try to sell them to you. The usual stuff like..'oh great selection.. So jealous you are eating it' etc. I liked the service since they try pretty hard.  They have a fair amount of veg dishes which is good since I am vegetarian. The forbidden rice sushi looked amazing and tasted better than any other veg  wrapped sushi I have ever had. The tempura veg was ordinary. The mushroom rice pot was presented and sold to me by the waiter and it tasted quite good. Like a Japanese risotto. The Brussels sprouts were awful!   I was expecting the place to blow my mind based on the menu prices. It didn't . It would have gotten five stars if the food lived up to the price. My significant other ordered meat dishes, she was not that impressed either.

I was shocked - SHOCKED - to see butterfish on their menu. I asked our server about it and I said "is that the fish that gives you intestinal issues"? She said "oh no, our chef is world class and he wouldn't have something like that on our menu. Butterfish is escolar." I responded "YES! Escolar is the fish that causes explosive diarrhea!" I then Googled it on my iphone and sure enough I was correct. Why on Earth would they put this on their menu I do not know.   I thought the restaurant was beautifully decorated and very warm and inviting. The service was somewhat knowledgeable and very attentive. However they did the thing that I hate the most and scream "corporate concept" - our server asked if we'd like sparkling or still water and when he asked for still she asked if we'd like Fugi or "Charlotte's Finest". It's a terrible attempt at upselling.   We had the pork belly skewers, blue fin tuna maki roll, king crab leg & salmon roll, tempura veggies, tenderloin and asparagus skewers, pork dumplings, tofu, edamame, etc. We had a wide range of dishes and overall they were all just good, but not exceptional and certainly not memorable. Especially not so for the price.   I'm still shocked that they have escolar on their menu. For that reason, and the lack of a wow factor, I won't be rushing back.

The theme of this place is cool, the restaurant is kind of sexy, the service is excellent, and the presentation of the food is unique and fun. The food itself though is pretty standard, so it feels bad to have to pay so much for it. This is a one time place for me, I don't regret it, I enjoyed it but I can similar quality food elsewhere for cheaper. Boom.

Great spot in Charlotte!! I live in LA but am in Charlotte about 3 times per year and this is the best thing you guys have going!! I have had robata at Katana on Sunset Blvd. in Hollywood and at Wolgang Puck's Robata restaurant in Vegas but this place tops them both! Very delicious and creative menu!! I will make Baku a regular stop when I come back to town!

We have been to Baku twice and both times have been blown away. This is the BEST sushi in Charlotte - hands down!  The quality of the fish is unreal, but the creativity takes it up multiple notches. This is now our favorite date night spot. The salmon belly sashimi has such amazing flavor that we start and END with it. I want the flavors to linger in my mouth and mind until we get to visit again. Sit at the sushi bar, the chefs are great and will help customize dishes. I'm allergic to shellfish and my husband isn't so they customized a roll to have half with and half without. No other sushi restaurant has ever done that. Can't wait until our next visit.

I want to start my review by saying that their reservation system is the worst. The reason I say that is because you will never see the time slot of 7-8:30 available to book a spot. I reserved a table for four at 6:30 and saw many empty tables while we dining until when we were leaving around 8:30. Now, the food: it is a very small limited menu so not sure what the hype is about. The dragon roll was my favorite and lychee martini was delicious. It is an overpriced place that lacks service (second round of drinks took forever to come) and variety in menu. I would likely not return here, we paid 200 some dollars for four people and  still left hungry and unsatisfied food wise specifically

Yum!  Date night heaven.  My husband and I came here a couple weeks back and it was delicious!  We ordered several dishes, mostly from the special menu but everything was tasty.  The sushi was super fresh but in my opinion over priced. The dumpling were tasty!  The sake was really good but overpriced.  The mark up was too much for what I know wasn't an expensive bottle.  The butterfish was very tasty as well and I would order it again.  Everything was pretty good but overpriced to me... Coming from New York I think that says something.  I don't want to take away from the food because it was good but not super special to explain the prices.  Perhaps we were paying for the atmosphere which was very nice.  Our server was nice but didn't offer any suggestions which wasn't super helpful but that was okay because everything was tasty.  We will come again when we want to spend a lot on some decent sushi

Cool ambiance, lots of variety on the menu, but pretty pricey.   It's a tapas place so things come out of the kitchen at different times regardless of when you order.   A few items everyone should order: the pork belly just melts in your mouth, asparagus nice presentation tastes even better than it looks, sweet corn definitely for sharing, black cod small portion but super delicious, chicken meatballs sauces are so tasty.

Placing 1-3 stars 3 being most liked by our group. Ordered the **Ribs, ***Soft shell crab roll, ***uni shooters, **sashimi plate, ***pork belly, *tomahawk steak, *dumplings, and *Brussel sprouts. Uni shooters with quail and truffle were my favorite. The pork belly came in next and was very juicy and tender. Raw scallop was perfect on the sushi plate, just wish there was more. The ribs were a bit too salty and the Brussels sprouts were too oily (even asked for them with out oil after seeing them on someone else's table). The tomahawk steak wasn't a great value and didn't compare to the others I've ordered around. It's our 3rd or 4th time coming here, we will be back but will try other items!

Simply amazing - great option if you are looking for inventive, interesting Japanese options.  We went there on a random weeknight after doing some shopping. Located in an older building across from the South Park mall, the overall impression inside is intimate and sophisticated. Great for a date night or going out with friends after work.  We order a cross section of small plates, including sushi as well as their specialty, grilled meats. Everything was spectacular, from the delicately assembled sushi (including an incredible butterfish with a citrus glaze) to the high-heat grilled items, in particular the scallops and the beef tenderloin. On a related note, if you are a chicken liver fan, you must get their skewered livers, probably the best I've ever had! The ingredients are all top-notch and the subtle flavor combinations are genuinely unique.   Service was very good - intelligent, well-timed and not pushy.  This place belongs on your top-5 Charlotte list!
This place is really good. Love the creativity and different menu. Love it but find it a bit pricey and too dark inside.

Great service, flavorful food.  Perf for groups that are looking to share lots of small plates and have an experience trying interesting foods.  Always get the crispy rice with spicy tuna on top, and the tuna tartare with taro root chips hit da spot.  The king crab legs make you feel like a Kween and the pork dumplings are everything u want in a dumpling.  Love yourself and come here with cash to blow, fun people and a free spirit.  While you're having a good time with ur crew, food will be poppin up at your table as its ready.  Once one dish is chowed down, the next one is on the way.  Keep dat lineup rollin

I'm so glad I'm not the only one who isn't completely wowed by Baku! Phew.  The fella and I visited on a Wednesday night after making Open Table reservations, and we parked in the back to avoid the valet.  Upon entering, literally seven Baku staff members were lined up to the right of the door to... welcome us?  Bizarre.  We headed upstairs to have a drink since the downstairs bar was already a little crowded.  Our bartender was nice, but fully admitted she was having an off night after making the wrong drink then spilling the right drink.  Oy.  The decor is really cool - dark walls, orange fans on the ceiling, painted eyes on the wall staring at you - the staff are all very chic and sleek.  It definitely has a clubby vibe.  Onto the food!  After our drink, we were seated upstairs. Our waiter was awesome - he was so gracious and helpful and didn't even make fun of me when I had to ask for a fork (chopsticks aren't my forte).  The fella and I got a bottle of wine and ordered three of the small plates/appetizers so that we could try a little bit of everything.    * The pork belly skewers were good, but there wasn't a ton of flavor, and they were TINY.  We got two skewers with two tiny pieces on each. * The rock shrimp tempura tasted very fresh and light, and since there were six pieces, I got to take a few more bites than of the pork belly. * Lastly, we ordered the beef and asparagus skewers, which were good, but nothing to write home about.  There were three tiny pieces of beef and one piece of asparagus.  Two drinks at the bar cost $11 and $12 + tip.  Dinner was a $50 bottle of wine and those three small plates cost more than $60... then we added tip.  The moral of the story is that Baku thinks A LOT of their tiny portions, and I had to eat a real dinner when I got home.  Cool, hip ambiance and excellent service, but I just can't justify the price for what you get.

Definitely get the ice box and the ootoro (fatty tuna) tartare if you are here for sashimi experience. The ice box will allow you to sample a whole range of seafood, including, but not limited to, tuna, fatty tuna, salmon, mackerel, octopus, scallops, etc.  The spicy tuna on crispy rice wasn't too spicy, but it definitely had that delayed heat at the end.  The amazing service and the loungey type of seats upstairs made this whole food experience even better.

I decided to write a review since they seem to be so mixed on here- and I almost didn't want to come thinking I would be disappointed. We started out at the upstairs bar with a couple Nigori Blue Martinis- Belvedere unfiltered vodka dirty martinis, so good we never even switched to wine during the meal, we just kept these comin'. Only $11- good deal. We sat downstairs at a booth, our server was awesome, all the staff seemed very polite.   Now- the food. We ordered a variety and shared everything. Favorite thing hands down was the tuna tartare with what I think were taro root chips- this stuff was heaven in your mouth. Other plates that really stood out were the salmon belly nigiri, rock shrimp tempura, and the yellowtail roll with serrano peppers, cucumber and avocado. Crispy calmari with serrano peppers was good too. We also tried the wagyu beef tataki, gokujo tuna roll, lobster & avocado roll, and of course we had to get the giant Madagascar prawn. Everything was delicious!! All of the presentation was beautiful and the plates rolled out a few at a time so we had a chance to really enjoy them. Decor is really cool, great vibe and relaxing & inviting atmosphere. Extensive sake list, will have to explore more next time. It was a great dining experience- I can't wait to try their brunch. Will definitely be back again!

When in Charlotte for work, a few colleagues and I decided to continue our nights of dinner sushi at Baku.  I am so glad that we did!   We ordered a bunch of sushi, apps/tapas and one of the dinners and just shared everything.  Absolutely everything was awesome and that includes the service as well.   Everything about our experience here was phenomenal - if I'm ever in Charlotte again , I will indeed be back.

We finally ate here. We had a reservation and it was a beautiful night, so walking in as I realized they have a patio, I hoped to sit there. We were told there was a wait and my husband was hungry so we got seated inside immediately.   I was told wine pours were small, so we both opted for a cocktail. My husband got a gin & cucumber concoction which he thought was kind of like lemonade. I got a wild tea vodka & cucumber drink. It was a little sweeter than I prefer but glad I tried it!  Now to the menu . . . our waitress, Morgan, was very thorough in explaining the style of the restaurant. She suggested an item from each page, but that seemed like a lot. But I guess in the end we probably ordered that much!   We started with the calamari which was delicious! Lightly crispy and delicate! We decided on two sushi rolls. Spicy tuna - yum! - and Forbidden Rice roll which had white asparagus. It was unique and tasty! For our next round, I asked about the baby artichoke skewers which Morgan highly recommended, as well as the rice bowls. My husband wasn't up for either, so we focused on entrees. We ordered Grilled Branzini b/c we'd never had it. It was 2 small slices of grilled fish (not much flavor!!) and a tomato salad. Very small portion and disappointing flavor for $24!! Since our waitress asked about it, my husband told her it was just ok and didn't have a lot of flavor. When she brought the bill, she informed us she took the Branzini off the tab! We greatly appreciated that!  All in all, it was good but not a great experience and not worth the $65 (total without the entree). I'd go back but not anytime soon.

This is a fabulous restaurant in several ways: Food, taste and presentation are impeccable-- Atmosphere, fun, inventive and inviting-- Service, warm but professional.  6 of us ate here last night and did all 'tapas style' dishes.  Every dish was truly exceptional, imaginative and absolutely delicious!  We look forward to returning!

A second review for one place? Still amazing. They've recently opened for brunch, and I absolutely had to stop in and try what they had working up. Here's my thoughts!  "Viking-style Brunch"   Fruit box - a variety of seasonal fruits served on bed of ice. Great to nibble on while waiting on my other guests to arrive. Enjoyed very fresh squeezed orange juice.   Liege Waffles - absolutely amazing. Lightly crisped waffles served with this great spread selection. Chocolate ginger and white chocolate mousse. We mixed them together. Incredible.   Sous Vide Eggs - sweet potato hash compliments the duck pastrami and egg that's cooked to a nice creamy perfection. All of this is drizzled with a yuzu hollandaise.. Making a very eclectic spin on the traditional brunch eggs Benedict.   There is a sushi cart offered with a widespread variety of rolls, sashimi and nigiris. We nibbled lightly on this .. Wanting to fill up on the brunchy goodness.   You're then offered a salad for the table... And we each got to select an entree. I chose the spicy filet... Always a favorite. My guests chose the jiodori chicken and the salmon teriyaki. We also devoured their wild mushroom kamamashi pot. Great warm ending to the meal. Especially for a rainy brunch Sunday.   I definitely recommend pairing your brunch with bubbles. We paired our waffles and eggs with the Moët Rose, but they offer a great list of bubbles and cocktails to start your Sunday off right.   Overall, Baku impresses again. For $36 a guest...to eat such an impressive array... Definitely a go-to brunch spot for something delicious that's a fresh change of pace.
Food was good but EXTREMELY small portions. Way too $$ for food. Paid $17 for 2, yes 2 scallops. No sides.  Glad we tried in once. Many other fancy places in Southpark that feed us more!
Very disappointed with our experience. If you are looking for an overpriced meal with poor service then this is the place for you.

Baku isn't bad. You pay for the ambiance for sure. I loved it inside, made for a great date night.  There isn't a big parking lot so that's a con. We went for an early dinner and found a spot easily. I'd suggest that. Our service was great, and our food was great. Not too much more you could ask for.

Intimate setting and a killer cocktail bar. Monday nights they offer 1/2 price bottles of wine. The selections I always gravitate towards are the Baku Yellowtail and Roasted Hamachi. This is a great spot for date night.

Amazing selection. Three words. Salmon Belly Nigiri. I travel for business and have had sushi in some of the best restaurants in LA, Vegas, NYC and more, and this might be the best tasting Nigiri I have ever had.
The best sushi in Charlotte. Chef Mark is the best! You must try this restaurant if you are a sushi lover!!
Baku is great. The spicy yellow tail was  amazing . Environment was tasty and intimate, great date spot. Would recommend and also come back.

Pricey but worth every penny. Our waitress was super knowledgeable and guided us well throughout our ordering. My husband and I enjoyed the whole experience and left satiated and satisfied. We were underwhelmed with the sushi roll we ordered - don't come here for amazing sushi. Come here to try out menu items you can't eat anywhere else. If it looks quirky, order it.

I can't get behind Baku.  It's not the portion size or the price but rather the quality and the taste quotient.    I'm a serious sushi guy and this places misses the mark.    I found the sashimi was either too cold or certainly not melt-in-the-mouth fresh.  The assortment was so plain I could have found more eclecticism in a grocery store and the slices were strangely extremely thick cuts, not at all expertly done.  Served on a giant block of ice this was boorish sushi 101.    They claimed to have fresh wasabi, but apparently don't know what this means as it was the powdery fake stuff.  I even asked the server and they thought it was fresh.  I didn't bemoan it in person because I didn't want to be *that guy* but the servers should at least be educated on the cuisine.  The Baku salad is the best thing to order here as the greens are fresh and the dressing light and sweet.   The edamame was disappointing and had a freeze-dried texture to it--eew!  As I'm a glutton for punishment I tried the miso-glazed black cod.  Even though I had pointed out to my server that I wanted to do a healthy meal, he didn't mention their miso cod is basically butter cod!!  I almost forgot the kumamoto oysters which were one step away from being off and garishly presented with giant watermelon bubbles which looked like some sort of sick growth.

Tried this place out the 2nd week it opened, and I must say, it was a phenomenal experience.  When walking in, you feel like you are in Tokyo/NYC/South Beach/Hollywood all at the same time.  Great ambiance and music.  It was quite busy that night.  I must also add that we had over 10 people in our party, so it was rather challening for our waiter.  I'll have to go try it again, to see if they improved on their service but other than that,  the food was excellent.  The dessert  was incredible!  It was a giant mountain (literally looked like a mountain) of ice cream gelato, cake, fruit and several other things.  Absolutely delicious!  What a great addition to SouthPark and to Charlotte in general!  So glad to see something more unique in this area instead of the usual Steakhouses and franchise crap.

Very trendy and sophisticated restaurant in the heart of Southpark.  I went here for a large birthday dinner with friends. It's located right across the street from Southpark Mall next door to the "ski slope" church.  I will preface this review with the fact that I'm not really into sushi.  My table ordered a special sushi dinner that was multiple courses and was not on the menu.  I didn't try many of the dishes. I will write about what I did try and rate it accordingly.  I ordered the skirt steak based on others reviews on Yelp. Thanks yelpers! It was fantastic! So juicy and tender. I'd go back just for the skirt steak.  The high light of the night was the Wagyu meat! It was amazing.  For $25/oz it better be though. It literally melts in your mouth it is so fantastic.  It was a special treat for the birthday party celebration. Not something I would order myself because of the high price tag.  Every plate that came out was presented beautifully and you could tell the chefs had taken a lot of time to display the food.  I had a great time with my friends but I don't know if I will be back here because of the steep price tag. Maybe I will check them out during restaurant week.   They do have a large bar upstairs and valet parking out front.

This is a very pretentious dump, designed to impress the socialites who neither value money or service. Apparently "Baku" is Japanese for tiny little portions that we charge way too much for. There were a total of four tables sitting yet we had to constantly wait for service... I had to get up at one point to wave down our server to get another $22 drink. The only positive is that what little food we got was actually pretty good, and the servers were all friendly.

This was my initial visit to this place and I found it wanting.   If you don't drink like my wife and I there is really not much on the menu for you.  When we went there was a total of 4 pages of food on them menu this was a whole book.   The food left us looking for something to balance out the salt and our water was not doing much.   The plates of food were small and the food to price value is low.  The food was fair to good at best.  I have had better for the price.

Stopped in for a round of cocktails and some dessert.  They were pretty busy so service seemed a little confused and slow.  Drinks were fine and the desserts were pretty good.  Our server even gave us an extra dessert because he felt that things were taking a while.  Thought it was a nice gesture.  Overall, 3 stars for our brief visit with them.  Nothing impressed me, but I had no real concerns either.

Baku was our ABSOLUTE FAVORITE when the restaurant first opened years ago. I was OBSESSED and bragged to my whole network about it. I mean, I was excited to post content on my IG to share our experience. I've my celebrated birthdays, even planned birthdays and bachelorette dinners there. Once we noticed our friends were not as impressed, it was a disappointment.   Baku to me was not only known for their unique menu, but it was known for the Baku "experience".   My last birthday event was December 2015. After my party of 28 were all disappointed in the service.   Last week we decided to give it another chance for our anniversary. The waitress was nice, but food was bland!  My favorite sides were sweet potatoes and grilled corn.  The potatoes were undercooked, corn wasn't seasoned, Sushi was bland, pork belly didn't taste as good as it used to, Kumamoto oysters were a disappointment, (especially after the cost) Shrimp skewers were dry, grilled grouper was slimy... and drinks were not crafted like they used to be.   For a 200.00 meal, we had to pick up more food afterwards at another restaurant.  This was very disappointing.

We went to Baku for their brunch buffet today and I would NOT recommend their brunch to anyone.  We paid $36 a person and we were very disappointed with their food selection.  According to their brunch menu, they make you think you getting sashimi and nigiri part of their Buffet but instead we were told is $2 a piece if we would like to order their sashimi/nigiri.  If you read their brunch menu carefully, there is NO WHERE in the menu mention is a up charge.  Don't waste your money on their Sunday brunch!

A very rare 5 STAR review from myself goes to Baku.  Located right on Sharon road near Diamonds Direct - Baku is very easy to find.  We were here last Thursday night at the suggestion of other yelpers - Thanks guys!!!  They had valet parking right out front in case you didn't want to try to hunt down a spot.  There is an upstairs and a downstairs where you can be seated.  Downstairs has the excitement of the open kitchen and very nice decor.  Upstairs is a little sexier with a bar, lounge areas, high tops and low tables.  We were told to get a few small plates so we ended up with the pork dumplings (seared slightly on the bottom - comes with the house sauce - DIVINE), the peppers (I can't remember the name?!?!), tenderloin and asparagus skewers, pork belly skewers, and shrimp tempura.  Each dish was delectable, not too smoky.  Just the right amount of food for two people.  The wait staff was super attentive (although struggling with the restaurant's newness still....)  The decor and music - so sexy chic.  The hot towel service was a great touch.  I can't wait to go back and try new items.  Superb experience and truly a unique Charlotte dining experience.

As far as sushi goes in Charlotte goes, I have to say this is one of the better ones. I like the balance of rice and fish in the nigiri, its not often I find a sushi places doing it right. They also have robata so there is cook food if you don't eat raw. Baku is a high end restaurant so I'm not coming here every night as much as I would like too but if you do come you will be able to try lots of different kind of fish you won't find in charlotte expect maybe Yama Asian fusion. I come here when I want to fancy it up.

Very cool place. South Park area needs more establishments like Baku. I haven't eaten here yet but have been for drinks with friends. Nice place to lounge around with friends. Lots of unique drinks and service was excellent. Will def go back sometime soon.

As good as it gets for Japanese in Charlotte!   Went here on a whim with a friend and it didn't disappoint. The rolls were very well made and the presentation was excellent. The Alaskan crab roll was one of my favorites. The food is mostly tapas style meant to share... and most of the small plate portions are a little small.   Everything grilled is cooked on a Japanese grill with coals imported from Japan which gives it a very unique flavor. Their black cod was excellent... I'm gonna say it reminded me of Nobu's... though the execution was a little off. All their beef is prime, we also had the Waygu NY strip and it was delicious.   Cocktails were ok, nothing out of this world and the service was decent. Overall I think they did a good job, albeit the NY city prices... this is a place good for an expense account.
Extremely refined food.  The blue fin toro nigiri with osetra caviar was luxurious.  Great cocktails and great wine list.  New to the neighborhood and will return.

Fresh and tasty. A different type of sushi than I usually go for but very good rolls and sauces. I generally go with traditional sushi and they don't vary from the menu. Small vat of sake so you will have to order a couple. Pretty pricey for my liking.

I love the presentations at Baku, each dish is beautifully presented and food is just as good.  It is on the pricey side but you can see it on their quality and presentation.  They also make great desserts, everything house made supposedly.  Recommend for date nights, company dinners and birthday.
Atmosphere was lovely and food was delicious, but be sure to bring your wallet!

From my research only place to get butterfish/black cod in Charlotte and it did not let me down. Make a reservation or plan to wait. Small portions meant to share. Slightly over priced for what you get but despite this will be back for that black cod.

2 stars only because the service was phenomenal and my date was a 10. However we were advised to try the chefs tasting (forgive me I dk what it was called) it was listed on the menu as $100. It was $100 a person which was well over priced and was not specified by the waiter. For $300 we were underwhelmed by charcoal and teriyaki flavored every thing. Go somewhere else in the South Park area. Much better options within one mile.

Ordered the tiger prawn last night to accompany a salad & wine BUT I was brought shrimp tempura instead; without any questions or explanation of the substitution. Not sure if they thought I wouldn't notice, but I definitely do know the difference between a PRAWN and a factory farmed SHRIMP. lol

Found this place late at night when we were craving for sushi. Got sat immediately for a big party in the PDR, and we got the best service! SERIOUSLY!! We tried many dishes and I was surprised this place served duck! It's phenomenal! They are also doing limited rare fishes and the live uni is urching-good(sea-urchin)! Will definitely come back here!

It's my first time visiting Charlotte. My boyfriend and few his friends took me to Baku. The foods are outstanding!!! I went to Morimoto in Philadelphia a month ago. I think the foods here are comparable to Morimoto. We ordered a lot dishes to try. My favorites were Sea scallops with foie gras?and wagyu beef. My boyfriend liked the duck breast, and salmon belly. I would like to come back again.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner on a Friday night and we had such a great experience. Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive. Neither myself nor my boyfriend knew what sake to get since they have such an extensive list and our server listened to what we liked and brought out a great selection. Additionally, we had no clue what food to get, and our server again took the time to figure out what we liked to eat and made some recommendations that were right on point. I had the chicken entree and it was delicious. Will definitely go back.
I love the ambiance, food was good, but not wonderful. I have had many meals in Charlotte that were much better, for the price.

A group of friends tried BAKU during Queensfeast/restaurant week.  Service here was wonderful and food was delicious.  We had one mistake during the evening and it was a steak not being cook according to ordered.  The wait staff and management could not have been any nicer and fixed it immediately.   We will definitely go again

Wow, thought I had already reviewed this place but apparently not.  Well for starters you have to love the interiors.  As stated in some of the other reviews, the upstairs area is preferred if you are looking to lounge.  I loved the ambiance of the place.    We came on their first official night open so there were some kinks in the armor, mostly relative to bar menu and drink selection but the service was friendly and prompt none the less.  The food was fantastic, the pork belly melts in your mouth and the shrimp tempura was divine.  The peppers we had were incredible and although considered a small plate, I found the portions to be fairly large enough for two.

Liked the decor and the server was extremely knowledgable . The drinks were on the weak side but I'm sure it was just a measured pour. We enjoyed the food we had the giant Madagascar prawn, the pork belly skewers, 2 different sushi rolls one was a blue fin tuna ,the other was crab and we started with the roasted oysters . The oysters were my favorite item, exceptional flavor and had me looking forward to what was next , all the food was prepared and presented exceptionally well but other than the oysters i wasnts "wowed" by any of the flavors.  We understood the portions were small as the menu is all Tapas style..( don't go looking for a large portion meal)  The mango cake and the chocolate lava cake were our  deserts they were also very good, the mango cake was a little dry. We like to eat at a lot of high end restaurants and expect to pay for it but I thought Baku was a little over priced for what it was.  It is a great place to meet for a cocktail then a couple of apps before dinner elsewhere ... Didn't hate it and had a great evening but not overly impressed.

Lovely new little spot! Went here for restaurant week and it was refreshing to know they didn't over book.  Downstairs and upstairs seating, bar on both levels. Our party was upstairs and I was able to get a small drink prior,  House sangria. It was average. They said they added Sprite normally to the drink,  which to wasn't the best idea.   Food overall was really good. Small plates, but all 3 courses were delicious.  For apps,  I had Pork Belly, main course, steak with Wasabi sauce, and dessert, Creme Brule.  Each course was better than the last and surprisingly filling.   A bonus to me is that it's smack dab in the center of 2 bank locations in Southpark. So weekend dining, you always have a parking spot. Not really much congestion.   Only con, I could give is that I wish there were bigger plates with more food!

Foodgasmic oysters and king crab legs!!  Seriously, they are MIND-BLOWING amazing!  I am a lover of fresh seafood, especially oysters and crab legs; it is very rare to find oysters and crab legs that blow my mind because it all essentially tastes the same.  That said, I also had a range of very good, good enough and blech dishes at the same meal; hence, the 4 stars.  OK AMBIENCE.  We have seen Baku numerous times on our way to South Park Mall and wondered if it was like Zuma (my BFs all-time favorite restaurant upon which all other pan-Asian | Asian fusion restaurants are compared).  The answer?  Not quite.  There is a cute patio outside that was much too hot for us to enjoy, maybe next time.    Inside, it tries to be trendy and hip like a Morimoto, Hakkasan or any other modern vibey LA/Miami Asian restaurant but sort of falls flat and feels a little dated and underwhelming.  I can't quite put my finger on what makes me feel this way, maybe the really bad lighting or the cramped quarters (even though the restaurant was sparsely attended).  It just didn't feel upscale (and not in the minimalist way either).   MEDIOCRE SERVICE.  The service was exactly on par with what you would expect from an upscale restaurant.   There was nothing remarkable about the service.  They can improve by wiping down the table between courses when they're clearing off the plates.  This isn't something that I usually notice but if I feel like I need to put my napkin on top of my table, that's a really good sign that it needs a good wipe down.  Overall, the service was fine; our food was served, cleared away and drinks refilled promptly and courteously.    ALCOHOL.  We had a Moscow mule and a fruity concoction that I asked the bartender to prepare; they were heavy on the alcohol pour but mixed wonderfully as to maintain their intended flavors.    A WIDE ARRAY OF CULINARY PERFORMANCE.  If it weren't for the oysters and crab legs, I may have given the experience 3 or 3.5 stars, right around average.  I've had:   AMAZING:  +++  oysters. When they were served, we were told to be prepared to have the best oyster experience ever. He was absolutely right.  I usually want to throw all the fixings on: cocktail sauce, horseradish, tabasco, salt, pepper, and lime -- but the sweetness, and the soft buttery texture of these divine oysters eradicated the need for the extras.  It was like these oysters weren't farmed in the ocean at all, they didn't have any salty or gritty texture to them at all; truly,  they were unlike any of their usual counterparts. +++  Alaskan crab legs. The crab legs were meaty, sweet and didn't have a fishy aftertaste at all.  They serve it in this heavenly lemon butter ponzu sauce that just perfectly complements the sweetness.  The portion is huge enough that my BF and I barely polished it off.    VERY GOOD:  +++  crispy rock shrimp.  The shrimps were crispy and served with a hot mustard sauce, very similar to Zuma. +++  traditional miso. It threw me off that it's sweet and a little sour but the fresh scallops in it really made me grow fond of it.   +++  spicy tuna roll. Very fresh, densely complex and quite spicy.    OK:  +++  yellowtail.  You get three rolled up pieces.  This is fine if it was more complex than plain yellowtail such as a nice ponzu sauce or crispy tempura flakes (like Zuma does); it was good but not stellar.   +++  panacotti.  The fruit panacotti had vanilla custard that was pretty bland.  I'm not one for over decadent sweetness but the panacotti seemed to err at the opposite spectrum and left my palate wanting more.   BLECH:  +++  salmon tatake.  I LOVE albacore tatake that sits on a semi-sweet citrus ponzu sauce with stripped daikon.  This wasn't it.  The salmon is cooked, even with the fresh crab,  it's really not the right texture to turn into a tatake.   +++  mango toffee.  Too many nuts, the very dense cake didn't taste like mango -- Starbucks could have done a better dessert.   +++  pork belly.  The pieces are REALLY fatty and greasy; not in the savory bacon (yum!) way.  COME FOR THE OYSTERS AND CRAB LEGS.   If the oysters and king crab had been your run-of-the-mill variety, we probably wouldn't return because other than that, the only thing we would order again are the crispy shrimp.  However, the oysters and king crab legs are absolutely incredible and worth every penny of their market price tag.    10.7.2016 Update.  We went for a second time on a rainy Friday night and because it was busier, the service was slower.  I'd skip the desserts altogether next time.    I can see why others say that the portions are not commensurate to the hefty price tag.  I will definitely vouch for the freshness and premium quality of their seafood (for example, in contrast, Cowfish uses imitation crab in their rolls).  That being said,  if you come here, stick to the popular food items or fresh sushi because not everything on their menu will otherwise garner a satiating dining experience.

Get the pork belly! It's so flavorful and so well cooked that I don't think I've had better. You won't be disappointed.   Service was great too, considering we went on a weekend. Our waiter Bob was extremely patient with our group. He explained what was currently popular for us to try.   Anyway, I can't wait to go back with my friend's birthday coming up!

I really enjoyed the various tapas here aside from the slow service.  I recommend ordering everything at once or else your dinner could be over two hours just waiting on a simple alcohol beverage or tapas.  It's a great atmosphere but the service is a little slow.  I highly recommend the uni spoon, very flavorful and delicious and it's $10 a spoon.  If you like uni and quail egg it's really worth it.  Also their raw Kumamoto oysters are the best and most expensive oysters I've ever had.
Not great. REALLY EXPENSIVE... there are half a dozen restaurants that do something better for cheaper. I thought it was a joke restaurant

Date night and we love sushi! To start off....the food was DELICIOUS! Each item we ordered was more delicious than the last! That being said, I cannot understand the low quality of service. Each server seemed to have a sense of arrogance. A different server brought us the wrong plate and when we asked him about the one we were supposed to have, he responded with "how would I know, I'm not your server, but I will go ask him." We sat at the sushi bar and went through most of the meal without ever speaking to a server again?? We poured our own wine all night, and sat with empty plates for 15 minutes before we asked for our check. Our server apologized for the lack of service and hospitality and offered to buy us a drink at the lounge upstairs & the bartender did take great care of us. I would have given Baku 4 or 5 stars but the lack of service brought it down. The restaurant would be great with just an improvement in service and hospitality.

OK, we moved out of Southpark and have little reason to want to go back (just a boutique or two for me). Tried Baku again. Small bites, Calamari, Beef & Asparagus & their incredible mushrooms. Not nearly the crowd they once had. We don't order the Chicken Yakatori anymore since I found myself chewing and swallowing what I suddenly realized was chicken cooked on the outside and raw on the inside. I panicked then (last thing I need is Salmonella) & our server said they had just sent an order of that back for the same reason - there is a special way to cook done on the Robata grill, and if they get it wrong (chefs keep changing - not master chef I think but whoever is on the Robata, and they mess up). And again I reiterate - THEY KEEP BLASTING THIS HORRIFIC, ELECTRONIC, DARK AND MISERY INDUCING MUSIC. We sat outside before 6PM when nobody was there, so we asked they turn it way down outside. It was done and someone then turned it way back up. This is a pricey place, supposed to be a Japanese restaurant and any music should be soft, melodic and Japanese - not ELECTRONIC DRECK. Staff were all wonderful, so who is the nincompoop who insists on blasting lousy "music" that has no place anywhere other than a PORNO FLICK? Mr. "Owner" - are you listening, or are you just one of those "old boys club" guys who currently run this town/city? You are getting slammed on your salon Cutting Image and your casual BBQ place "Tree House".? No plans to go back to any of them. Better give a raise to your staff, I don't know how they can stand working there, they must all be good actors.
Baku was good, but somewhat expensive. I understand that the Japanese charcoal cooking method is unique and more costly. Not a bad experience. Just wasn't a wow.
Best restaurant in Charlotte.  Try the ribs, tempura shrimp, pork dumplings and New York strip.  You won't be disappointed.  Great cocktails.

A recent encore visit to Baku reinforced what a tremendous restaurant this really is. We started with a splendid Calamari appetizer, which was flavorful, crisp and delicious. The Wagyu Tataki and Lobster rolls that followed were wonderful, especially when paired with a steaming bowl of the Wild Mushroom Kamameshi and a refreshing Asahi Super Dry lager. We finished the meal with a sumptuous slice of chocolate cake with white chocolate mousse -- a fantastic ending to another amazing meal at one of Charlotte's best restaurants.

It is absolutely blowing my mind that this place doesn't have the 5 star rating it deserves. Every single thing we have ever had here, every time we come, is AMAZING! If you're a fan of Soul (in plaza Midwood), or O-ku in atherton mill, then you will LOVE what this place has to offer. Fantastic selection of apps (the tartare and the tempura cod bites are out of this world good), and the prices are reasonable IMO. There's almost never a wait either, so that's a huge plus. I'm not sure what's up with the other people (maybe they consider Applebees good eats), but from one foodie to another, this place is a must try.

Quality was good. Presentation was beautiful. Service was ok. They should've changed out our plates at least once during dinner as our plates were drenched in oils and flavors from the other dishes. The Uni Spoon ($10/each) was my favorite... had the perfect amount of caviar, truffle and uni, and the blend with the ponzu and quail egg was great! The A5-12 Japanese Wagyu Beef Nigiri ($8/pierce) with Burgundy Truffle and Hon Shiso was another one of my favorites.   I was very disappointed in the Salmon Belly Nigiris as that was what drew me into wanting to go to this restaurant. The salmon belly was fresh but the flavor was off because the chef had a big dab of mayonnaise on each piece.  The flavors did not go together and the mayonnaise took away the flavor of the fish. I feel that this was my main problem with this restaurant... the combination of flavors just did not go together. They would have fresh ingredients that are amazing even all on its own but then they would add something that overpowers the main ingredient. Another example was the yellowtail sashimi ($12 for 3 pieces)... the yellowtail was great, the truffle ponzu sauce was great but then they added this overpowering pickled smoky onion in it which in my opinion, totally ruined the dish and seems like such a waste of good quality fish. They could've added some onions but not so much where it was more than the fish itself. Another example was the Foiegras and Scallop dish ($28 for 2)... foiegras.. perfectly cooked, flavor was great... scallop... perfectly cooked, flavor was on point... and then they add this mint leaf that tasted like licorice in the middle which totally caught me by surprise and added this overpowering, pungent flavor that had a bitter aftertaste. Overall, good experience but disappointed in the dishes I was most excited to try.

My husband and I chose Baku for a weeknight dinner date during Queen's Feast. We've heard great things about the place and definitely were not disappointed.  Atmosphere:  Cool, eclectic vibe. Host, bussers, and waiters were very attentive and personable.   Food Must-Haves:  -Chili-glazed edamame. My mouth waters just typing about it - it was seriously SO good. Do it. -Brussels sprouts were also delicious.  -Potstickers are also a very solid choice. Ours were piping hot and the dipping sauce was very tasty.  -Robata Grilled Atlantic Salmon (entree) was seriously one of the best salmon dishes I've ever had.  -Green Tea Creme Brulee (because it's creme brulee...duh)  So-So items: -Spicy Himachi Rice Krispie Treat (appetizer)... didn't taste like much, and definitely NOT spicy (bummer). Nothing to write home about. -USDA Prime NY Strip... pretty fatty, came out in thin strips. Again, nothing to write home about.   Overall, we'll be back, Restaurant Week or not!

We were so incredibly pleased with our Restaurant Week experience at Baku! The food was great, portions were reasonable (I'd heard otherwise) and our server, Bob, was fantastic! We enjoyed it so much we took advantage of the Queens Feast AAA special on our way out and bought $200 worth of gift cards for $100. So, we'll be back, Baku!   To the food... We shared the edamame, crispy brussel sprouts, fried calamari, petite nigiri, salmon, skirt steak, pear fortune cookies and chocolate truffles with raspberry coulis. The ONLY dish I didn't love was the salmon but I am admittedly a picky salmon eater. My favorite of the night was the skirt steak, hands down. A big, 8-oz. portion, perfectly cooked and served with a yummy dipping sauce. Runner up was the nigiri -- each piece came topped with something different (a dill cream on the salmon, cilantro on the tuna, etc.) that really highlighted the flavor and freshness of each piece of fish.   The atmosphere was fun! We were in a booth towards the back (near the samurai room -- aka men's bathroom) which allowed for conversation with our friends. The restaurant is dark and has a swanky feel. Glad I decided to wear a dress. Felt like a real night out on the town! But, for only $35.00 per person thanks to Queens Feast! I'm withholding my 5th star until I visit outside of restaurant week and can judge regular menu items and service.

We have been here a few times and had excellent experiences every time. Creative menu and presentation. Excellent service. Can get pretty busy so reservations recommended.   I find myself craving their hamachi jalapeño roll. It is my new favorite sushi roll (I tend to like simpler rolls to the fried, zillion-ingredient versions). My son swears that their spicy filet (?) is the best steak he has had next to Ruth's Chris. He orders it every time we go- and eats the whole thing!

The food here is excellent!!! I have been here about 6 time now and it has always been above par. The service is just as good as well. HOWEVER, the last time I was here the 2 young hostess had a serious issue with I guess being at work on a weekend. They were extremely rude to my party and I and gave us stank looks the entire time as we were seated in the front.  With that being said I will no longer be visiting this establishment. But again the food is amazing the the wait staff lives up to the expectation you should come to expect within that price range.

Baku is worth every penny! My husband and I have been several times. The tuna tartar and scallops are delicious!!! We also loved the duck and cod. The only dish I would not recommend is the rock shrimp. It tasted like your basic fried shrimp, rather plain.  If I could eat here every weekend I would.

We LOVED our experience! Food was incredible, a true work of art, very fresh! Drinks we're great and our server was very informative. The only downside was that the music was a little too loud! Other than that, amazing experience. We will be back

Came here for Queen's Feast and it was pretty good, but pretty expensive. We ordered off the Queen's Feast menu and ended up ordering more food off the regular menu because of the small portions. We were still hungry, but decided to go elsewhere that was cheaper to fill up on food. Also, the brussels sprouts here are good and they have fried onion flakes that move from the heat which looks pretty cool.

Halloween night dinner!   I wanted to pick a fun place for dinner that would have a festive theme - but I wanted something different. Baku was it. They had a DJ set up that gave the upstairs area a fun vibe, and there were a handful of people dressed up.   I made reservations and my party was seated at a comfortable table behind the bar. We noted the cool decor along with a few funky Halloween items.   The wine list is neat: they have a few unusual items. I tried the Bollini Pinot Grigio, and my friends took part in the specials. The prices were fair on drinks - this is a nice place in a great location so don't expect dive-bar prices.   The food comes in a tapas/sharing style. I split the Robata skewer of tofu, and the Tempura Rock Shrimp. My other friends had the salmon, dumplings, sushi, and it all looked really good! On the next trip, I plan to try some of the substantial dinner plates.  With the way they made the tofu taste awesome, I'm excited to see what else they have to offer.  The waitress was very attentive to our large, festive group, and kept checking on us between her other tables. Even though it was a busy night, the service was consistently good.  I'm planning on coming again.

I had dinner here and it was amazing! I wish I could eat here every day! The inside is decorated very nicely and is very clean. The food has so much flavor, and the service is great! I recommend this restaurant to everyone!

I sat with Chad at the Sushi Bar and had a memorable meal. I tried so hard to enjoy every bite, it was so flavorful. Salmon tataki, Wagyu tartare, black cod are MUST haves.  Chad was awesome, exceptional service all around, great menu, nice wine selection. This place ranks up there with some of the best restaurants in San Fran and NYC.  Just go!

the decor is nice, kind of upscale rustic.  I love the sound panels on the ceiling.  what a great idea.  The food... Grouper Bites... a bit oily, not crisped up, but still tasty.  I also loved the green tea-infused salt.  That was new and interesting.    Pork Dumplings, again, oily, and a little thick in the skin, chewy.    Tenderloin Skewer...sort of bland.  The pricing is what I'd expect for Charlotte, but I don't think the food rates those prices.  We sat at the bar downstairs, which is a nice bar, but smaller.  Our bartenders were very nice but one bartender was really loud and he would make loud comments about what he was watching on sports center and when he was chatting with other staff it was obtrusive.  Also in the bar area... everyone from the kitchen staff, managers, hostesses... would come behind the bar to fill up their drinks, get ice, check out what was going on on sports center, chat....  It was really a bit irritating.  The bar isn't that big and although I would choose to sit further away from the tv side if I'm eating at the bar next time - it was just odd that it is set up that way.  I recommend people try it and I definitely want to sit upstairs next time.

The service was and is more than disrespectful. I have never heard such blatant racist crap in my life. I'm here to have dinner and seen a best friend of mine, whom was having a birthday dinner. To prevent making this story to long, I was told that we were an inconvenience. Of course my friend had many that stopped by to say hi and she didn't pay their "$500 reservation fee" but I  came to eat and wanted a table. The manage decided to give me a 20 minute explanation than to just clean the table and seat my party of 4. The food is awesome, no doubt but for the manager to feel as though a paying customer is an inconvenience because I didn't look like the other party was disgraceful. Let me not forget to mention that we stood their for 15 minutes as the staff walked past us without even acknowledging our existence. The manager did let me know he isn't under a corporation so he can do as he pleased. Wow is all I have... Maybe he forgot about social media and its ability to bring awareness and change.   Never have to worry about me coming again.
What a wonderful experience!  My first time and the range of flavors and unique combinations will blow your mind.  This is my new favorite in South Park.

This is the best sushi I've had in south Charlotte. Been here twice. Very fresh and well prepared. They have great by the bottle wine/sake specials. Posh and trendy atmosphere. It draws all sorts of crowds...I've seen business people by their lonesome eating and working, couples night out, and large group parties. The upstairs lounge is really a great place to unwind and also eat. Parking isn't too bad. Enjoy.

I been looking  for my favorite sushi place ever since we moved to Charlotte area 8 months ago. By far, this is my favorite sushi place. Smaller portions ( don't expect the usually big rolls from  them) .  They are pretty small but big in flavor.  I recommend it.
Had brunch here today, the food was amazing! The meal was a preset menu. It was good. I'll be back soon. For sure.
Baku is arguably the best restaurant in North Carolina.
Best sushi in Charlotte:   Tiger shrimp Blue fin toro tartare Spicy hamachi rice crispy treat Big hourany roll Salmon belly nigiri

Best dinner spot in Charlotte... By a long run. Small plates are fun and allow you to order a little of everything.  I did not have one dish I didn't like.  The only reason we stopped ordering was because we were full.
Great food, intelligent service (they know the menu, flavors, and options), and ambiance. Good wine choices!

I really wish I could give Baku a 4 or even 5 star review, but the service we just had was pretty disappointing. We went in for Queen's Feast Restaurant Week, and everything we ate was pretty tasty. We added on the pork belly skewers per our server's recommendation, and it was delicious! The biggest issue here was attentiveness of our waiter. He was very friendly and enthusiastic, however, it wasn't even that busy, yet we frequently ran out of water. We also asked about sake when we placed our order, yet the expert did not come around to explain until the end of our meal. One of our dishes was forgotten, and we had to remind him we ordered it. Worst of all, when we were ready to leave, it was very difficult to get the check, and we had to even ask another waiter to ring it up for us. Again, the food was above average, but overall, we expected better service.  Update: After writing this review, my boyfriend went to Whole Foods to buy a sandwich because he was still hungry. Not exactly what you want after a $100+ meal.

My fiancé and I came to Baku for the first time on my birthday. The service was wonderful and food presentation was excellent. We ordered the pork dumplings, chicken wings, spicy tuna roll, and the butter fish. Everything was just ok. Asian food is my favorite cuisine. I have eaten at Asian restaurants all over the country and this is one of the lowest on my list. Maybe the chef was off tonight, I don't know, but he or she must not have been tasting the food. During dinner we even starting discussing what we were going to eat when we got home. Unfortunately this visit was a fail for us, and we may not be coming back.

Restaurant week is always a good time to try new places that are at a higher price point.  Bakus restaurant week menu is $35 plus $5 extra for dessert.  Walking in the ambiance is so perfect.  It's romantic and quiet which makes for a nice evening meal.  We arrived about 10 minutes early and were seated immediately.  I always love when restaurants do that!  We ordered some drinks and then placed our order off of the restaurant week menu.  I got the edamame, pork dumplings, NY strip, and split the chocolate cake and beignets for dessert.  I was a little disappointed that dessert was $5 extra on the restaurant week menu, but both desserts were so good I wanted to lick the plate   Let me say that all of my courses were incredible.  I loved everything!  The portions were enough to fill me up and I ate every last thing on my plate.  The reason I'm giving 4 stars is because the kitchen was very backed up.  It took forever to get each course.  Our waitress was apologetic and kept our drinks full though!

Wife pick Baku today to try during restaurant week. The restaurant has a very nice relaxed atmosphere and very clean restrooms. We didn't know this was a tapas restaurant and the portions are, IMO very small compared to other Tapas restaurants. The food was EXCELLENT!! Our server Dave was very attentive and answered any and all questions we had. He also made recommendations on the restaurant week menu and explained the ingredients and how it was made. I recommend eating a snack or something before you go or look forward to digging down close to your knee to pay the bill.

Food was delicious, service impeccable, atmosphere was amazing!  I will definitely be back!  The pork dumplings were tender and flavorful and the rock shrimp tempura were perfectly seasoned and piping hot when the arrived at our table- the perfect way to start our meal. Next we tried the butterfish which was unlike anything I've ever tasted- the butterfish, white asparagus and sauce came together and were nothing short of magic. The spicy filet of beef was cooked perfectly and so tender that I was easily able to eat it with my chop sticks, and the sauce was heavenly. Then we enjoyed the largest king crab leg I have ever seen, with sweet local corn and baby artichokes.  Please do not leave this restaurant without having dessert, we tried the dark chocolate espresso truffles with sour cherry sauce and cinnamon/ginger snap ice cream-  i could eat that dessert everyday for the rest of my life and never tire of it.  Long story short it was the type of dining experience that makes you want to call all of your friends and demand that they to go experience the wonder that is Baku! I promise you will not regret it.

I had two roles there. One was a sort of spicey tuna and the other was a wagyu with pickled something with truffles. They both were amazing. The ambiance was amazing. My next trip I'll be getting the wagyu tomahawk ribeye.

A new Izakaya restaurant, very posh and upscale.    I expected an izakaya to be less formal and less stiff. More of a watering hole for the tired salaryman but this place has turned the local watering hole into a semi-formal dining establishment. Lots of uniformed waiters, a sake sommelier, a valet.. its just a wierd vibe for an izakaya.  The clientele is all dressed up for dinner, in heels and all. Kinda snobby.  Service is impeccable. They will take very good care of you. Our server was cordial and attentive.  We just about ate everything on the menu. Even had their Nanbu Bijin Dai Ginjo. Kitchen is fast. Our skewers came very quickly.  The best is the scallops and prok belly. So good, we asked for 2 more plate. The Omakase, at $60 for 3 was expensive.  There simply wasn't enough to justify $60 for 3.  I would say the portion was enough for 1 person.  All the other plates were OK.  Nothing too spectacular.  Sake list is good. They had a few bottles from JunMai to DaiGinjo. We had the KiKuSui , which came is such a small 300ml bottle is was pathetic. We stepped up and got the $150 Nanbu Bijin that was much better. The next time , I would ask them to sit the bottle in a bed of ice. I kinda like my sake colder.  Anyway, its not your typical relaxed, let your hair down, end of the day, drop your butt down and drink your tired day away of an Izakaya.  People actually dress up and come here to be seen. Sorta different vibe, sorta pretentious..but damn good service.  It is on the pricey side.

We made reservations an hour before we arrived on a Saturday night and had to wait a few minutes for our table, which was fine because we was able to check out other parts of the restaurant. Giving this restaurant 3.5 stars because of the pricing in comparison to portion size.  The food here was delicious and the atmosphere was lively. Our service started out a bit slow, but it gradually got better after we had ordered our small plates. The items came out as they were done, which was perfect because we were able to enjoy and savor each dish separately.    As a caution, this restaurant is very pricy so if you come here be ready for a big bill. We had 4 cocktails and shared 7 small plates/sushi rolls and our total came to $260.   Also, the valet is complimentary too.

Overall, I really enjoyed this restaurant. My SO and I went for the first time during Queen's Feast, and despite the crowd, the service was phenomenal. We were about 30 minutes early for our reservation, which the staff wasn't able to find, so we went to the bar for a drink while we waited for our table. Despite not being able to find our OpenTable reservation for 8:30 and the restaurant being at capacity, the staff handled the situation exceptionally well and we were seated at a table at 8:30 with no problem. Service in the bar was a little slow while we waited for our table, but the bar was standing room only, so that may have contributed to the slow service. There was a live DJ in the bar, which my SO and I really enjoyed. After being moved to our table we had a wonderful server and bar drinks came much faster. We had 6 different dishes, which was a perfect amount for the 2 of us. If we went back, I think 4-5 would be plenty though. While all of the food was good, there were some definite stand outs. The sweet chili edamame was one of my favorites, as were the rice krispy treats. My only complaint was that my salmon was probably closer to medium well than medium, but it was still tasty. My two biggest complaints were that they only had 1 restroom stall for the ladies' room, which created a line at times. And it was unbelievably hot inside the restaurant - this may have been due to the number of people, but other yelpers lead me to believe this might be an ongoing problem. Overall, I was very happy with our experience at Baku and the SO and I would certainly go back! I do strongly recommend making a reservation, as table space is limited and it's a popular spot.

Swanky, sophisticated, and stylish.  I've really enjoyed the food each trip here. My most recent visit was for a large birthday dinner. My side of the table ordered a bunch of things to split. Shout out to Yelpers who post pics. We definitely nailed our order because of Yelp photos. The skirt steak and spicy hamachi crispy treat were the two main stars and standouts. Pork belly skewers were also delicious. We also got a couple sushi rolls, fried chicken, rock shrimp tempura, spicy edamame, and shishito peppers. All great. I tried bites of both the spicy filet and the strip, the skirt steak beat both of them.   For a large group, our two servers did a fantastic job. My service is always great. I recommend making a reservation beforehand. Note: half price wine on Mondays.  I will say that Baku is kind of pricey for what it is, but I still come back. Highly recommend making a visit here during Charlotte Restaurant Week (January & July).

Really great food, service started out great with the hostess being attentive to get us seated on a busy Sat night.  Upstairs is very dark and loud for dinner.  Server was great until he checked out without communicating that to us.  Once we were bartender's table our level of service fell.  And the bar's trash odor kept hitting my nose in waves.  No offer for coffee with dessert and really just a disappointing end.  Highlight of our meal was pork belly skewer with Dumplings a strong second.

Japanese Fusion... Went there for my Wife's Birthday with her Brother and my Sister-in-Law... Excellent! A bit pricey, but Excellent... The food was amazing, the service was amazing and the desserts were also - Amazing! The Best Sazerac I have ever had! Highly recommend, we will go back.

My friend and I selected this for her farewell dinner from Charlotte. This is a terrific addition to the South Park culinary scene - the ambiance and decor are warm and welcoming. We ordered the forbidden and spicy gokujo rolls (I preferred the spicy rolls) which were both good. The tofu skewer was crisp and excellent with the chili sauce that accompanied it. The kimchi bowl was a real treat, which I wasn't expecting from a Japanese restaurant. The sorbet dessert was ok. Timing of the food delivery was perfect, and the host was very attentive. Glad I came here (even though it was a hit to the wallet) and would recommend it for a nice evening out with friends.

Living in the Southpark area, I had heard from many that Baku was a 'must-go' restaurant. We finally decided to try it out this week for Queen's Feast. I ordered the Hidden Hibiscus cocktail and it was bubbly & refreshing. The music was audible but wasn't too loud that we could not hear ourselves speak. We were unaware that the menu was Japanese 'tapas' style, but our server gave us a long rehearsed speech about the menu and restaurant style.
