The Queen's Feast selections were described well on the menu but the portions were rather small. The spicy chili edamame was great, but edamame isn't hard to mess up. I ordered a type of maki roll with yellowtail; it came out in 4 tiny pieces. The tiger prawn & vegetable tempura consisted of 2 skinny tiger prawns, a 1/4 of a mushroom, 2 asparagus stalks and a piece of eggplant. Quite disappointing.   I am glad we went here for the reduced price during Queen's Feast as opposed to paying triple the price on a regular night. I wouldn't rush back here again.
Someone led us to this awesome place. They got really wonderful sushi and sashimi. Roast beef and chicken are also yummy. The only drawback is that it's a little expensive hh.

I wish I could remember my bartenders name. He was absolutely on point . Upstairs bar. Feeling a little home sick , missing the southwest spice. He made me feel right at home with a Serrano pepper mottled in my vodka grapefruit juice. The staff went out of there way to make us feel welcome. They made us some specialty rolls that were not on the menu and were on top of every need or want. These guys are truly a class act!!!! Definitely go out of your way to visit this place!!! Amazing ambiance!!!!!!

Baku is a baby born in a different city. Something charlotte has needed for years. Its pricey, but depending on your selection, it doesn't have to be. The food is insanely good, with a robata grill that doesnt disappoint. 25 specialty cocktails has something for everyone...a true gem amongst a typical crowd of charlotte run of the mill/generic repeats. The interior design shows true effort across the board. A welcomed addition to the southpark area.

I read other reviews and had high hopes for Baku since sushi is one of my favs.  I was reallly disappointed.  We got there at 6pm on a Friday night.  Being across from the mall you would have expected this place to be packed. Maybe that should have been my sign.  There were only 3 customers.  A lady at the bar, me, and my honey.  We were seated and it took 5 mins before the waiter came over.  The server was nice enough.  The only thing more plentiful than customers were nats!  We kept having to swat our food and drinks.  Geez. We ordered 2 miso soups(red and traditional ) and 2 apps(baked oysters and seared tuna). My honey usually has no strong reactions to food but we agreed...horrible. Oysters fishy and not fresh - i almost resorted to spitting the one I ate in my napkin.  Seared tuna was absolutely tasteless. The soups were ok. We decided to leave after a disappointing start and fighting nats in hopes of salvaging our night out.  Maybe it was just an off night for Baku- but bad enough for me to have no desire to return.

BF & I dined here this past Saturday. We got here a little before 630 & apparently the entire restaurant was booked with reservations, with the exception of the bar & the patio. It was pretty nice outside, so we decided to sit out on the patio. Our server was extremely knowledgeable. They have an extensive list of sake, & I'm not a sake expert but I decided you can't go wrong with the flavored ones. I got the fuji apple sake & my BF opted for the lychee sake.. both were great but the fuji apple was my favorite!  They have a few vegetarian items on the menu. The ones I remember are coal roasted shishito peppers, a couple of mushroom maki rolls, some type of sweet & sour tofu skewer, & wild mushroom kamameshi pot. I decided to get the peppers & was almost going to choose one of the sushi rolls, but I decided to try the kamameshi pot instead. The peppers do come with bonito flakes sprinkled on top, so we got them in a separate little bowl. My BF got the tempura tiger prawns, beef & asparagus skewers, & soft shell crab maki roll.  The shishito peppers came out first. They were tasty & not really spicy. They came with a little dipping sauce made of soy sauce & chili flakes. $7 was a little steep for a plate of peppers but I enjoyed them & would get them again.  The tempura tiger prawns came out next.. $12 for 5 pieces of fried shrimp.. what?? I kind of laughed when the prawns came out because at that price we were expecting at least ONE more to make it an even $2 per prawn. I did not eat them & while my BF seemed to like the prawns, he said they weren't really anything special.  Next up was the wild mushroom kamameshi pot. It came to the table unstirred, but I was unable to get a picture of it at the time because our server stirred it while explaining the dish. I enjoyed the flavors but again felt it was overpriced at $17 for some rice, mushrooms, & a few vegetables. The nice touch was that the rice on the bottom was a little crispy from the hot pot.. love it!  My BF got his beef & asparagus skewers (I think it came with 2) & soft shell crab roll. The skewers looked much better in person than that shitty picture I posted (blame the BF for that!) I think he liked the skewers & the roll was comparable to Cowfish prices but definitely not in size & taste.. Cowfish wins that hands down! I don't remember the exact prices of these 2 dishes individually, but together they must have been around $25 based on our bill.  Overall, the service was great, sake was awesome, & the food, while good, was definitely overpriced. We weren't particularly blown away by any of the dishes which is kinda disappointing for a meal close to $100 (including the tip). We will probably be back because my BF wants to try the duck & a couple of other grilled meat dishes, but Baku will likely not be in our regular rotation.

Baku ,this has been our"go to" spot and best place to dine since coming here for visiting , Do not let the prices on the menu hold you back ,The establishment and the layout is phenomenal and the dining area is expansive.  And their dishes were exceptional .very creative and eye enticing .we can't remember everything we had (not good at naming dishes ) but basically ,everything was very unique and top notch .if u r a dessert fan ,(like me )definitely try their Yuzu Tart and Akuma (Pistachio Gelato) ?service was a bit slow but still on point .
Melange of colors, Thing of beauty and tastes good, Just get the sorbet.  Place is overhyped, Pay too much for what you get, Baku, not Haiku?

After hearing many mixed reviews on this restaurant, I finally got to experience Baku.  For starters, as expected, the restaurant was indeed stylish...a cozy mix of rustic and city-chic decor.  Then came THE disappointment for the entire dining experience...the TINY table.  As I often dine out with my husband, it's fairly normal that we get the smaller tables in  most restaurants, but here at Baku, the table for two seemed a tad smaller than norm.  It might not have bothered me much if we simply opted for simple entree plates.  However, as recommended by the waiter, this was a restaurant that specialized in smaller plates (AKA tapas-style!).  Since the menu did feature many tantalizing appetizers and tapas-style items, we proceeded ordering at least half a dozen plates, along with soup, dessert and drinks.  Our table was completely overwhelmed...and honestly, it was an aggravating, near-claustrophobic foodie experience.  The menu was delightful, with many unique items...and all the foods were delicious.  I do want to add that some of their items, like the sushi that I ordered was way overpriced for what it was...but again, delicious.  Also, the waiter was very good...an obvious pro with years of experience.  Overall, I did like what Baku had to offer.  If my dining experience was more comfortable (bigger table!), I might have even given this 5 stars.

Came here last night for restaurant week...one of the best experiences I've had recently! The sea bass was incredible, and the sushi was the freshest I've ever had in Charlotte. The cocktails were delicious and the service was very attentive. Definitely recommend this for a date night.

I will never eat here again!! This was the worst racist place ever!!! Went there for my friends birthday just to have drinks. We ordered food and several other people she knew came as well! About 7:30, 4 other people we knew came by then it was a small crowd of her friends. The last 4 people that came were told by the manger that they were "Inconveniencing the waiters" because she should made reservations and paid the $500 fee to reserve for 25. 25 people did not show up! The place was not packed and we were paying customers! The fact that we were African American and none of the "other patrons " were harassed made it even worse! The food was mediocre and the portions were small. The drinks were ok and the waiters were slow. I'm never coming back.

Fantastic!  My wife and I went to Baku on a Monday, and had a wonderful experience for our anniversary.  We had a reservation, but it probably wasn't needed on a Monday.  We sat upstairs, enjoyed cocktails, and tried most suggestions with great results!  From start to finish we loved every dish, and they surprised us with champagne and an over the top dessert platter.  Just... Wow!  Yes it is expensive, and yes the wine is overpriced (we passed on expensive recommendations) but cocktails and food were top notch, and worth it!  We will enthusiastically return and can't wait to bring friends.
Just average. Seems to have gone downhill a little bit the last few times we have been. I really wish a great sushi place would open up in Charlotte, we need one badly!
Great sushi- service struggles a bit. But good sushi is hard to find and the food has never disappointed

This was the third dinner at Baku and we really enjoyed all aspects. I love the food here and the drinks are well done. I noticed and it is true that this is an expense be place to eat... We tasted and did not over order and our bill was not outrageous.  I always believed that the last thing you want to be cheap is raw fish :)  We will continue to dine here for special occasions. Sorbets were incredible too.

This evening was my 5th time dining at Baku. The last few occasions I have dined here the food and service have been impeccable. Easily Baku has been in my top 5 choices for dinner in Charlotte, especially on special occasions. Tonight was quite a diversion from the norm. Focally there were multiple items not available, Shishito Peppers, several other appetizers, and a few entrees. In the past we had been captivated by the Tomahawk steak and Wagyu beef. Well understanding that the other entrees were "tapas" portions, for the money it was a bit meager. One of the six in our party ordered diver scallops, which sets the expectation they should be large. Unfortunately they missed expectations and were small. With all of the absent dishes the flavor of the dishes and service are the only reason I am giving 3 stars. I heard the menu is being updated, but still not a good enough reason for having so many missing dishes. Lastly if it weren't for the aforementioned positives I would have rated tonight a 1 or a 2. I hope these issues are temporary and I look forward to possibly giving it another try soon.

Went with work colleagues and was pleasantly surprised with ambiance matching the food quality. Service was impeccable as were the Lychee Martinis!!  Highly recommend and will definitely be coming back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

Check this out guys! So i went to baku last week and had amazing time over there with my fiancé because i love the setting first of all. It was kinda cozy and good for a date with your man. secondly, i cant wait to talk about this the food that i got there. It took all my breathe because I'm a food lover and esp. a prawn( big shrimp) lover. Lol i didnt take a picture at the time because it was so good i was rushing thru my plate but i can definitely share the picture from their instagram picture. This is the one im talking about! If you ever feel like wanna get your hand a little dirty(lol) but looking for something delicious, i recommend you go there and try this one!

So it's been almost a week since I've been to the restaurant and I CANNOT WAIT to go back!!!  It was sooo good! My Friends and I tried the Omaskase Menu! Amazing doesn't even describe how fantastic it was! The flavors of the food are incredible!  So yummy! HUGE Sake List! GREAT atmosphere, loved the décor! Loved the service! Our Server was very friendly. Staff was very attentive. My compliments to the Chefs, you guys are AMAZING!! Impossible to walk away hungry! What a FANTASTIC experience.

I went to Baku and enjoyed everything about my experience. There were three people total in my party and we shared six dishes. We tried the salmon belly sashimi, the calamari, the forbidden roll, the softshell crab roll, the seared blue fin tuna and vegetable tempura. The salmon belly sashimi was the best! The forbidden roll also had amazing flavors and the other dishes were extremely enjoyable. I would come back here over and over again to try out the dishes!

I had a farewell dinner with my dining buddy, who is moving. Who is going to be game to eat out with me now? *Sigh* Anyhow, Baku was the last hurrah for the time being and it was okay. I arrived later than intended and she was gracious enough to allow me to have her last tiger prawn. These were shrimp sized prawns to say the least and the smallest prawns I've ever eaten. That being said, the sauce that they come in is heavenly and I used it as my condiment for literally Every dish that was served. Want to take great sushi to the next level? Dip it in tiger prawn sauce. Jidori Chicken too bland and far less impressive than a past visit? Dip it in tiger prawn sauce. Brussel sprouts have too many flakes and taste burnt? Dip it in Tiger Prawn sauce. Calamari was great, but you guessed it. I dipped it in tiger prawn sauce as well just because.  Service was excellent. Our waiter was very knowledgable about the menu, and even gave us the background on how each food was prepared. Did you know the 20% over pricing at Baku is because they cook with organic charcoal flown from Japan? I cannot make this stuff up. Major polite smirk. The thought of someone labeling charcoal as organic cracks me up. That's where we are as a society.  I'd give a 3.5 if it was an option. Nevertheless, it is not and I'm rounding down because of the chicken and Brussel's sprouts. I'll be back sooner than later.

Holy moly! Come hungry...and with a lot of money. Ha! It's expensive, but SO WORTH IT. Charlotte needed a cool establishment like this. Especially for an Asian aficionado like myself, I am always on a lookout for cool Asian food that is perfectly prepared and artistically presented. Think Asian tapas, and remember that they will be small portions. The server recommended that we each order 3 or 4 plates. The plates range from about 10-30. See what I mean about expensive? But one taste of the pork belly, and you'll be emptying your wallet on the table and summoning the waiter for more! Arigato!

Great atmosphere, service, happy hour alone are reasons to frequent Baku, but they are just the tip of the 'berg. My favorite feature is the food presentation. The chefs go out of their way to make every dish seem like a special. Seared Scallops with Foie Gras, Roasted Quail, Toro Tartare, anything Wagyu comes with truffle. Don't get me started on the sushi. Find a reason to eat at Baku !

Okay. So let me start by saying that I would actually give this place 3.5 stars - pretty good food, great service, small portions and overpriced. But Yelp doesn't give me the option of doing half stars so I'm gonna go with three.   We did girls night here and we each did the restaurant week menu. Now when we sat down, the server said he recommends that everyone get two dishes and it's meant to share. Let me tell you, I'm not sure who is sharing these dishes because the serving size is small. There was a woman next to us who was served her brussel sprouts when I got there. She dramatically said "oh my goodness! It's so much food! I won't be able to finish this!" I looked over to see no more than 7 cut up brussel sprouts on her plate. *insert eye roll here* Let me tell you, my girl friends and I all were easily able to eat every item (and we each ordered three separate dishes/courses - no sharing here).   I started with the brussel sprouts and they were wonderful! They had tons of flavor and the texture was amazing. My next course was the dumplings. I loved the flavor and they were crispy on the outside. I also really liked the green onion and peppers on the side that I tossed into the ponzu sauce. For the third course, I had the salmon and, after squeezing the lemon on it, really liked it.   My friend was still hungry and ordered the chocolate cake and said it tasted like a little Debbie cake and wasn't worth the price.   Had this place been more reasonably priced, I would've definitely given it four stars but give the portion size and price point, I think three stars is reasonable.

New favorite restaurant! Great atmosphere coupled with equally great food. I went sushi/ sashimi and the Dragon rolls. Extremely fresh and some of the best sushi I've ever had. My husband had the lamb chops and loved them. Said they were tender and flavorful with a kick. Must do dining!

I've visited Charlotte several times and always wanted to try this place. Well, I finally did a couple weeks ago and unfortunately I wasn't impressed. Our group of four ordered:  Rock Shrimp: The sauce served on the side is a little different from what I've had at other places, too much mayo. But anything fried tastes good :-) Wild Mushroom rice pot: Best dish we ordered and the most filling. Get this! Omakase (for 4 people for $20/each): beautifully presented and so fresh, but there's literally one piece for each person. So 4 octopus, 4 salmon, 4 oysters, etc (see pic) Chicken/Onion Yakitori: A little salty, had too many burnt edges. Still good enough to eat. Pea Blossom Maki Roll: 6 small pieces. nothing memorable   While the food was good and the seafood was fresh it just didn't blow me away. At these prices- either increase the portion size, have amazing top notch service, or decrease your prices.  Also, there was a piece of hair weaved into the basket our rock shrimp was served in. We immediately told our server, and he brought out a new batch. However, it would have been nice if he had communicated that dish would be comp'ed bc the whole time we were thinking how bad the service is since most restaurants would comp it. Only later to find out when the bill came they did comp it! But it's pointless when you're in a bad mood throughout the entire meal.   Another minor incident was a dirty sauce dish. Glad we noticed before using it for our sushi!  Maybe it was just an off day...but I just can't justify the food and prices when I can get the same thing in ATL for so much cheaper and better service!  Fyi- the guys were still hungry, so they each ate a bowl of pho afterwards. LOL

After my initial review last November, the manager of Baku reached out to me and kindly offered to send me a gift card to try the restaurant again. I have been meaning to go back but since I travel a lot I was finally able to have dinner there last night. A few weeks back my parents went with some of their friends and told me they had a wonderful experience! I was excited to give Baku another shot and they definitely have vastly improved since my last visit. The service and food were both great! I will definitely be coming back. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered a variety of items but the standouts were the asparagus, the spicy tuna on crispy rice, the lobster & avocado roll, the tiger prawns tempura (not too breaded), and the chirasi. We also loved the chocolate coconut cake - it was delicious! I was also impressed with the drinks - I got the cucumber jalapeño margarita and also tried the strawberry tune. Both were super yummy and innovative. Again, I will say that it is definitely on the pricey side, so be prepared to spend! :)   It definitely goes to show that it is always good to give restaurants a second chance, especially one that is fairly new. I appreciate the manager for reaching out to me and I look forward to my next meal at Baku.

Wonderful as always. Each dish is stunning and delicious.  Our server Chris Smith was perfection, no rush, no annoyance he left us take our time and enjoy a lovely evening. Thank you, Chris. See you soon.

I have now eaten at Baku three times and it is fantastic.  The downstairs is a warm inviting restaurant setting and upstairs is a little more raucous.  So if you like the loud music and more a club feel, go upstairs.  If you prefer a quieter experience, stay downstairs.  As for the food, the menu is very big.  It was a little intimidating the first time and I spent too much time worrying  over what to order.  My advice is each person pick 3 or 4 things and then sit back and relax.  Things will come out as they are ready so delicious surprises show up at your table at a steady pace.  And trust the pairings your chef makes!  One of my favorites was the scallops with foie gras that came with some pickled plum.  Who knew but just a little of that plum with it made it perfect!  Try and be a little adventurous and let your servers help you with suggestions.  They have been spot on.  You can ring up a big tab here.  There are definitely some really pricey items.  But there are also plenty of reasonably priced things as well.    I have no complaints about the wait staff.  They have been courteous, helpful and knowledgeable every time.
Overpriced and not so great being that I live in California. The waygu though is amazing and the waygu nigiri topped with caviar and truffles is my must order.

Took my husband here for his 30th birthday. Made our reservation on opentable.com and someone from baku called the next day to confirm the reservation.  We were both highly impressed with the whole experience. We got the "chefs choice" dinner, where basically the chef chooses and sends out several courses. everything tasted amazing! Even the beef tartare that I very nervously tried was amazing. My husband said the NY strip grilled over imported japanese charcoal was the best steak he's had in Charlotte (and the man knows steak!) the service and food were impeccable. We will definitely be returning!  I also definitely recommend the hibiscus champagne cocktail!
The food was overpriced! But at least the waitress was really sweet when she asked if we'd be interested in the chef's omakase special...unfortunately we declined at $100 per person!!!

I don't get why so many people are raging  about this place. Here's my tale of disappointment:  Went here last night since everyone that I knew of was telling me that I gotta try it and that my fellow yelpers said some of the reviews here are just flat out lies. So I came here to accomplish both goals of getting the experience first-hand and write a honest review.   So, back to the story, I came in (had a appointment at 10pm) and I immediately notice the type of people that goes here. Let me tell you, I'm from a pretty well-off family, so I know the difference between wealthy people and snobby ones that doesn't have the money but just act like they do. And I noticed there were ton of those snob. Which is strike one on my list.   Later on at 10:10 pm I was asked to be seated in the back of the room which I'm not fond of since I prefer seating in single seat but oh well. The waiter then gave me a tour through the menu, however, he only went over wines and sake, saying how great their drinks are. I had to ask him about foods, and he wasn't really sure about the sushi when I asked him questions on how fresh it is. Minus another point.  After ordering, the waiter brought out my wine and assuming that I paid nearly $50 that I would get a pretty decent wine (and the waiter even recommended it) I was extremely dissatisfied. I've travel to France and know what good wines are, and let me tell you, the one that Baku serves you are cheap quality wines for extremely ripoff price. You can buy it for 1/3 of the cost!  Now, onto the foods.  Disappointing also... The presentation look good but the taste and quality is a c- on my book. The steak was bleh since it wasn't flavorful (even though they said they are well known with using organic charcoals to make their grill foods delicious).  The duck meats was still kind of raw (goodness gracious) and the plum didn't suit with the duck meat. Their flavors were too different to be combined which made the dish taste unsettling.  Sushi.... Just flat out no. Sushi didn't taste fresh and way too watery. And the sauce that they used did not compliment the sushi, rather it hinders it by creating sour taste.   I don't mind price when it comes to food that are worth it. But when I receive foods that are poorly made, then my friend, I'm quite pissed off. If you want to go here and show off that you have money and claim that it's delicious then go right on ahead. But if you're like me, who actually prefer true culinary skills then this place isn't worth for you to come.   Well, that is the end of my extremely long story of woe. xox
One of the best places in town. Food is awesome! Try the lamb, best lamb I've had. And that tomahawk 40oz steak is out of this world. Great date place, it's a must-visit place in charlotte

Went here with my fiancé, his friends and their significant others during restaurant week. We pretty much shared the food and got every dish from the menu. The food wasn't really anything special from other Asian restaurants. Service was fine. For a nice restaurant in southpark area I didn't expect the restroom to just be one stall. Probably won't be back. I rather spend close to $100 for 2 people elsewhere

We make reservations for my birthday party on a Thursday night at Baku. It was really calm on the first floor and I guess it's where older people like to hangout, so we decided to go to the second floor.   We had 2 different rolls, oisters, salmon and a fillet minion and some drinks. Nothing impressive about the food, it was all about small plates very well decor. Our bill was $200+  I did enjoy my birthday, but not enough to come back for dinner.

I've been twice, "they" always say try everything twice!  The first time my boyfriend and I sat upstairs totally different vibe (lounge setting) which we loved. We didn't really order a lot of food, we wanted to have a couple of drinks and eat light, so we ordered the snow crab (maki roll) and rock shrimp tempura appetizer.  The appetizer came out first, and it was very good, but I told the waiter it was suppose to come along with the sushi! It took 45 mins for the one sushi roll to come out, but it was amazingly good when we finally got it! They actually gave us an extra appetizer to make up for the mistake, which was very nice! The second time we went in for dinner, we actually was seated downstairs, but moved upstairs because the vibe is better (our opinion.) We ordered the Chilean Sea Bass, Baku lobster roll, and the snow crab roll again. The Chilean Sea Bass was a small portion, but well worth it because it was amazing, and both of the rolls were as well! I would definitely recommend giving Baku a try, the service, drinks, and food are amazing!

The food was ok, the portions are really small for the price. The steaks are all over cooked and when we were there it was hot as hell in there! We couldn't enjoy our food, would  probably not go back there for what we spent, not worth the money!!!!

Good, but overpriced. Not worth the cost considering the quality and quantity per plate. Service wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. Parking also somewhat of a pain in the small lot. This place just isn't worth the time, trouble, or cash.

The only reason we went to Baku was because our neighbor gave us a gift card there. For some reason I wasn't interested in it, but now I am really glad we got that gift card, because it was a really enjoyable experience.   We sat upstairs in an area that seems like the bar/lounge section, and it was nice. Our server was lights out (baseball reference).  She was on top of everything, extremely friendly and helpful, and all of her suggestions were great.  It was Friday night, so I am guessing she was on their A squad.   The menu has tons of small plate variety, and it seemed like everything we ordered was great.  Chicken meatballs, NY strip tataki, corn, kimchi, pork dumplings, etc.  Our server said they cook the food over some imported hot stones (I only eat off the finest stones)...which I guess is a good thing, because everything tasted great.   For dessert, I highly recommend the truffles.  There are a lot of good things happening in this dessert. The presentation of the food is excessive and awesome (ice everywhere, food floating on various towers, and I think I saw some gold bullion in the background). The actual dessert tastes great, too. The truffles taste like chocolate batter and they come in this almond brittle cup.  There is also this ice cream perched on top of an ice sculpture, which is no slouch either.  We'll definitely be back to Baku in the near future,

Have come back here a few times since my first visit, and haven't been impressed with the food or ambiance. Loud techno with rushed sushi isn't a great combo in my book.  That said, it still has decent sushi just a little on the expensive side.
Love the food the service the atmosphere. It's just amazing.  This is great for friends and family I'm impressed by the staff the atmosphere and the food. Get the tomahawk. It's to die for.

This review is only the restaurant service only. The food was kinda pricy and in very small portions, appetizers. I really liked the cozy feel, our waiter was very knowledgeable and kind. The food, flavor, atmosphere was very pleasing, presentation of the food was Excellent. Offering something for the whole family. My husband and I enjoyed our meal. The restaurant was both clean and tidy, having plenty seating. The hostess/ waitress was attentive at all times. Staff members there greeted us in/ out when we left. The food was not filling at all, but it was enough to hold us over for a few hours. Loved all the dishes thus far, but be prepared to spend some money.  We would recommend this facility. Im sure everything is a must try!
It took me three years but I finally found it, a spot that serves good, GREAT, sushi in Charlotte. It's Baku. The sashimi and sea urchin melts in your mouth. Yes, melts in your mouth.

My husband and I dined here for our Anniversary on October 23rd.  It was our first time there and it will definitely not be our last.  The service and food were phenomenal!  Our waiter, Mark, definitely made us feel comfortable and since we had never dined at Baku before, he went over the history and menu with us.  He was very knowledgeable, hospitable, and helpful with our selections.  We decided to order a variety of things to share.  Each of the plates were spaced out perfectly, so as soon as we were done with one plate, a new plate came just minutes later.  It was absolutely delicious and we will definitely be returning.

Terrible experience. Super expensive for what it is and not worth it at all. Please save your money and go elsewhere. I emailed the restaurant numerous times to tell them about my experience and they never contacted me. Terrible customer service.
